instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 no thunderbolt
threads.message: Customer complained of no thunderbolt. No liquid damage. What to check first? 3.3V on both sides of D9425.

threads.title: 820-2936 no thunderbolt
threads.message:
Check solders, traces and adiacent components of J9400.
T29_A_HV_EN goes high when connect a Thundebolt device?

threads.title: 820-2936 no thunderbolt
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]Solders traces and components of J9400 look fine.

T29_A_HV_EN 0V with connected thunderbolt device[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: 820-2936 no thunderbolt
threads.message: Refering to J9400, check DP_PWR and HOT_PLUG_DETECT, w/ and w/o TBT device connected.

threads.title: 820-2936 no thunderbolt
threads.message: solved on its own after measuring for DP_PWR
